channel.title: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs
channel.description:
it came to my attention that my hard drive has a transfer rate 7x the rate that this model is suppose to be. im not complaining im just wondering why when i use dacris benchmark that it says my hdd transfer rate is 2240 MB/s . i found out that the model my hdd is only 300 MB/s. the fastest hdd next to mine was the classmate who has a $4000 alienware laptop which had 110 MB/s.
if someone could explain why i am getting this that would help me not be so confused. my computer has intel rapid storage technologies installed(it came install when i bought it from the store) and running but i dont think that would do that much of a performance boost seeing it has something to do with RAID and i only have 1 drive.

item.title: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

SATA type SATA-II 3.0Gb/s

I am not sure if I should be happy or not?

I used a program called Speccy.

Read full topic
item.source: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs

item.title: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:4, topic:390647”]It got higher? I thought lower >.<

Doesn’t matter atleast its better now.[/quote]

hitachi says the model of hard drive is suppose to transfer up to 300 MB/s, while mine is at 2200+ MB/s according to a benchmark i took. other classmates have used the same benchmark software and get 20-110 MB/s. so we are all a little confused. but ya its nice to know my hdd transfers at 2+ Gb/s.

Read full topic
item.source: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs

item.title: 7x hdd transfer rate of hdd specs
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

B2300 T4nk:

Maybe if you removed ram from your computer, that mightve slowed it.

i have 4 gigs of ddr3 my computer is stock, and the question is why is it so high, its 7 times faster than it sould be, but like i said im not complaining, im just wondering.

Read full topic
